head.supplied: 17/1/94. ¶ ¶ This is a mark of honor to ¶ our branch ¶ from the great home-society, dear Mr Macdonald, not to me personally, and should cheer ¶ us all ¶ on in our work. ¶ Could the Rev Mr Potter...

div.p: A38, The Royal Geographical Society of Australasia (Victorian Branch), Mitchell Library, State Library of New South Wales, Sydney.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;

div.p:
This is a mark of honor to our branch from the great home-society, dear Mr Macdonald, not to me personally, and should cheer us all on in our work.
What? See 94.01.22 – sounds as though M has been offered a high position at the forthcoming International Geographical Congress in London.
Could the Rev Mr Potter get me an interview with Mr Giles? I shall be very thankful for your putting me in oral communication with Rev. Mr King. You will find Mr Hobson at the Australian Club. I am thinking and thinking how to get new monetary means for our field work in 1894, but as yet do not see, where it is to come from. There seem few [sool]
souls? in all Australia who can enter on our subjects with a clear conception and generous impulse. But we must not despair. If I had only some leisure, I might succeed better. Let us have a Council-meeting at your Office towards the end of the month

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
